step: Cite specific titles and section numbers in-text.
Start your "Works Cited" entry with the author's name.
Provide the title of the source.
Include the name of the publisher and the date the code was last updated.
Identify the location of the code.

task: How to Cite World Bank Data
step: List "World Bank" first as the author.
Provide the title of the page and the publisher of the website.
Indicate the date you last visited the page.
Close with a direct URL to the page.
Use commas instead of periods in footnotes.

step: Start with the author‚Äôs first and last name.
Include the title of the ALR in italics.
Note the key numbers for the ALR from the index listing.

task: How to Cite an Encyclopedia
step: Separate citation elements with commas in footnotes or endnotes.
Omit the name of the author in footnotes or endnotes.
Provide the name of the encyclopedia in italics.
Include the title of the entry in quotes.
List publication information only if necessary.
Give additional information for online encyclopedia entries.

task: How to Cite an eBook
step: Start with the author's name.
Provide the year of publication.
List the title and format of the book.
Include any additional identifying information.
List the author and the date for in-text citations.

task: How to Cite Abstracts
step: Start your footnote with the first and last name of the author.
Provide the title of the article and note you're citing the abstract.
Include information about the journal where the full article appears.
Close with a DOI or URL for the abstract.

task: How to Cite a Textbook in MLA
step: Write out the author, title, editor, and edition.
Include the publishing information and database where you found the book.
Specify the URL, if applicable or desired.

task: How to Cite a Wikipedia Article in MLA Format
step: Open Wikipedia.
Find your article.
Find the "Tools" section.
Click Cite this page.
Scroll down to the "MLA Style Manual" section.
Copy the citation.

task: How to Cite a Textbook
step: Start with the author's first and last name.
Provide the title of the book.
Include publication information.
Add pinpoint citations for a specific chapter.
Use the author-date style for in-text citations.

task: How to Cite a Painting
step: List the artist's name first in your bibliography entry.
Provide the title of the painting.
List the date the work was created.
Add information about the materials and dimensions of the work.
Include the name and location of the museum or collection.
Close with the URL and date of access if you viewed the painting online.
Add a full citation for the source if you viewed the painting in print.
Trade periods for commas in footnotes in the text of your paper.
